      • process

        protected abstract Exceptional<I> process(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull Exceptional<I> exceptionalInput)
        An abstract method which defines how an input should be processed.
        Parameters:
        exceptionalInput - A non-null Exceptional which contains the input value and throwable
        Returns:
        An Exceptional containing the output value after it has been processed by the pipeline

      • processPipe

        protected Exceptional<I> processPipe(IPipe<I,I> pipe,
                                     Exceptional<I> exceptionalInput)
        A default method for processing a pipe, which handles converting the pipe, checking that they're not illegal CancellablePipes and passing forward the previous input if the pipe throws an error.
        Parameters:
        pipe - The IPipe to be processed
        exceptionalInput - An Exceptional containing the input to be processed by the IPipe
        Returns:
        An Exceptional of the output of the IPipe
        Throws:
        IllegalPipeException - If you try and add a CancellablePipe and the pipeline is not cancellable

      • isCancellable

        public boolean isCancellable()
        Returns:
        A boolean describing if the pipeline is cancellable or not

      • getCancelBehaviour

        public CancelBehaviour getCancelBehaviour()
        Returns:
        The CancelBehaviour of this pipeline

      • setCancelBehaviour

        public AbstractPipeline<P,I> setCancelBehaviour(CancelBehaviour cancelBehaviour)
        Sets how the pipeline responds if cancelled by an CancellablePipe or any child pipes of it.
        Parameters:
        cancelBehaviour - A CancelBehaviour describing the cancellability of the pipeline
        Returns:
        Itself

      • processUnsafe

        public I processUnsafe(@NotNull
                       P input)
        Unsafely processes an P input by calling process(Object, Throwable) and unwrapping the output value without checking if its present.
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null P input to be processed by the pipeline
        Returns:
        The I output of processing the input, unwrapped from the Exceptional without checking if its present

      • process

        public Exceptional<I> process(@NotNull
                              P input)
        Processes an P input by internally calling process(Object, Throwable).
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null P input to be processed by the pipeline
        Returns:
        An Exceptional containing the I output. If the output is not present it will contain a throwable describing why

      • process

        public abstract Exceptional<I> process(@NotNull
                                       P input,
                                       @Nullable
                                       @Nullable java.lang.Throwable throwable)
        An abstract method which defines how an P input and a Throwable should be passed to process(Exceptional).
        Parameters:
        input - The non-null input value
        throwable - The nullable input Throwable
        Returns:
        An Exceptional of the output

      • processAll

        public java.util.List<Exceptional<I>> processAll(@NotNull
                                                 @NotNull java.util.Collection<P> inputs)
        Processes a Collection of P inputs by internally calling process(Object) on each input in the Collection and returns the result as a List of Exceptional.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The non-null Collection of P inputs to be processed by the pipeline
        Returns:
        A List of Exceptional containing the processed I output of each input

      • processAllSafe

        public java.util.List<I> processAllSafe(@NotNull
                                        @NotNull java.util.Collection<P> inputs)
        Processes a Collection of P inputs by internally calling process(Object) on each input in the Collection and returns the non-null results as a List of I outputs.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The non-null Collection of P inputs to be processed by the pipeline
        Returns:
        A List containing the processed I output of each input, if not null

      • processAllUnsafe

        public java.util.List<I> processAllUnsafe(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull java.util.Collection<P> inputs)
        Processes a Collection of P inputs by internally calling process(Object) on each input in the Collection and returns the result as a List of I outputs, including null values.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The non-null Collection of P inputs to be processed by the pipeline
        Returns:
        A List containing the processed I output of each input, even if its null

      • cancelPipeline

        public void cancelPipeline()
        Cancels the pipeline which prevents it from processing any further IPipes.

        Uncancels the pipeline.

        protected boolean isCancelled()
        Returns:
        If the pipeline is cancelled

      • removeLastPipe

        public void removeLastPipe()
        Removes the last IPipe from the pipeline. If there are no IPipes in the pipeline, this does nothing.

      • removePipeAt

        public void removePipeAt(int index)
        Removes a IPipe from the pipeline at the specified index. If the specified index is out of bounds, nothing will be removed.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the IPipe to remove

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns:
        The number of IPipes in the pipeline

      • clearPipes

        public void clearPipes()
        Removes all the IPipes in the pipeline.
